Package stind

Class STIND

java.lang.Object
stind.STIND
public class STIND extends Object
Simple InputStream wrapper that aims to simplify input operations

  • Method Details

    • read_line_throws

      public String read_line_throws() throws IOException
      A Result-less version of the read_line() function, that opts to throw the exception instead. This function has to be surrounded with try/catch statements.
      Returns:
      The String read from the InputStream
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O Exception that occurred when reading from the InputStream
      See Also:
      • Same function that uses Result instead

    • read_line

      public Result<String,IOException> read_line()
      Function that reads a String from the InputStream the class is listening to. It makes use of the Result type in order to avoid having to use try/catch statements.
      Returns:
      The result of the operation, with either a String or an Exception contained inside
      See Also:
      • Result-less version of the same function

    • read_chars_throws

      public char[] read_chars_throws() throws IOException
      A Result-less version of the read_chars() function, that throws the exception instead. This function has to be surrounded with try/catch statements.
      Returns:
      An array of the characters read from the InputStream
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O Exception that occurred when reading from the InputStream
      See Also:
      • Same function that uses Result instead

    • read_throws

      public byte read_throws() throws IOException
      A Result-less version of the read() function, that throws the exception instead. This function has to be surrounded with try/catch statements.
      Returns:
      The first byte read from the InputStream.
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O Exception that occurred when reading from the InputStream

      The result of the operation, with either a Byte or an Exception contained inside

    • read_bytes_throws

      public ArrayList<Byte> read_bytes_throws() throws IOException
      A Result-less version of the read_bytes() function, that throws the exception instead. This function has to be surrounded with try/catch statements.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList with the bytes read
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O Exception that occurred when reading from the InputStream
      See Also:

    • read_bytes

      public Result<ArrayList<Byte>,IOException> read_bytes()
      Function that reads the bytes from the InputStream the class is listening to. It makes use of the Result type in order to avoid having to use try/catch statements.
      Returns:
      The result of the operation, with either an ArrayList of Bytes or an Exception contained inside
      See Also:
      • Result-less version of the same function
